article.title: Testing Images
article.content:
table-of-contents
=================

end-table-of-contents
=====================

This is some text.

Here's a [link](/use/).

External images
---------------

### Markdown

Markdown syntax works fine:  
![aws small](https://galaxyproject.org/images/logos/AWSLogo.png)
`![aws small](https://galaxyproject.org/images/logos/AWSLogo.png)`

### `<g-image>`

`g-image`s don't work with external links, so you can't resize them:  
`<g-image src="https://galaxyproject.org/images/logos/bioconda_64.png" width="50"/>`  
<g-image src="https://galaxyproject.org/images/logos/bioconda_64.png" width="50"/>

Local images
------------

### Markdown

If you don't prefix with `./`, it interprets it as a module, tries to import it, and gives an error:  
`![world](World40.png)`  
<g-image src="./module-error.png" />

But even if you use `./`, non-existent images also cause an error:  
`![world](./WorldASDF.png)`  
![error](./module-error-not-found.png)

The old relative-path Markdown syntax also works here:  
![world](./World40.png)
`![world](./World40.png)`

You can do relative links to outside the current directory!  
![aws small](./imgdir/AWSLogo.png)
`![aws small](./imgdir/AWSLogo.png)`

You can even go up a directory!  
![aws small](../AWSLogo.png)
`![aws small](../AWSLogo.png)`

`remark-attr` is now working!  
`![bioconda](./bioconda_64.png){width="100"}`  
![bioconda](./bioconda\_64.png){width="100"}

`remark-attr` percent values are interpreted as pixels:  
`![bioconda](./bioconda_64.png){width="50%"}`  
![bioconda](./bioconda\_64.png){width="50%"}

### `<g-image>`

Relative paths also work with `<g-image>`:  
<g-image src="./World40.png" />
`<g-image src="./World40.png" />`

You can also reference other directories:  
<g-image src="./imgdir/AWSLogo.png" />
`<g-image src="./imgdir/AWSLogo.png" />`

And you can still traverse directories:  
<g-image src="../AWSLogo.png" />
`<g-image src="../AWSLogo.png" />`

Non-existent images still cause an error:  
`<g-image src="./WorldASDF.png" />`  
![error](./module-error-not-found.png)

Resizing **does** work with `<g-image>`:  
<g-image src="./bioconda_64.png" width="250" />
`<g-image src="./bioconda_64.png" width="250" />`

So do classes:  
`<g-image class="float-right" src="./bioconda_64.png" />`
<g-image class="float-right" src="./bioconda_64.png" />
